alert.note: Alert for Central Sacramento Valley including Glenn, Colusa, Yuba, Northern Sutter, Butte County Below 1000 Ft; Eastern Mendocino NF; Eastern Portion of Shasta, Trinity NF; Northern Sacramento Valley to Southern Tehama County Line Below 1000 Ft; Northern Sierra Foothills from 1000 to 3000 Ft. Includes Nevada-Yuba-Placer RU and Anador-Eldorado RU; Southeast Edge Shasta, Trinity NF and Western Portions of Tehama, Glenn RU; Southern Sacramento Valley In Yolo, Sacramento, Far Western Placer, Southern Sutter and Solano County Below 1000 Ft - Excludes the Delta (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued September 19 at 2:32PM PDT until September 21 at 6:00PM PDT by NWS Sacramento
info.description: ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY EVENING THROUGH THURSDAY AFTERNOON FOR GUSTY WINDS AND LOW HUMIDITY FOR FIRE ZONES 213,215,216,217,263,266 AND 279... The National Weather Service in Sacramento has issued a Fire Weather Watch for gusty winds and low humidity, which is in effect from Wednesday evening through Thursday afternoon. * Winds...Northerly winds 15 to 25 mph with gusts 30 to 35 mph. * Humidity...Wednesday night: Overnight recoveries of 35 to 55 percent. Thursday: Minimum relative humidity of 17 to 25 percent. * Highest Threat...West side of the Sacramento Valley, mainly along and West of I-5, as well as the northeast foothills. * Impacts...The combination of gusty winds and low humidity can cause fire to rapidly grow in size and intensity. Outdoor burning is not recommended
info.instruction: A Fire Weather Watch means that critical fire weather conditions are forecast to occur. Listen for later forecasts and possible Red Flag Warnings.
